title: Deir Yassin Massacre
description: On April 9, 1948, Zionist militias massacred at least 107 Palestinians, including children, women, and elders, in the village of Deir Yassin near Jerusalem.

title: Abu Shusha Massacre
description: The village of Abu Shusha fell to occupation on May 14, 1948, after multiple assaults, despite the villagers' efforts to defend their homes.

title: Tantura Massacre
description: In May 1948, Israeli forces massacred nearly 200 Palestinians in the coastal village of Tantura, which had surrendered during the Arab-Israeli War.

title: Lydda Massacre
description: On July 11, 1948, Israeli forces attacked Lydda, leading to the massacre of many residents in this town, which was originally part of the proposed Arab state.

title: Saliha Massacre
description: The first village where a massacre was committed by Israeli forces' 7th Brigade. They detonated a mosque, killing 60 to 94 people inside.

title: Al-Dawayima Massacre
description: In October 1948, regular Israeli forces massacred many residents in the village of al-Dawayima, with killings taking place in homes, a mosque, and a cave.

title: Qibya Massacre
description: A force led by Ariel Sharon attacked the village of Qibya in the West Bank, killing numerous Palestinian civilians.

title: Kafr Qasim Massacre
description: On the day of the Tripartite Aggression against Egypt, Israeli border policemen killed residents of Kafr Qasim on orders from military commanders.

title: Khan Yunis Massacre
description: During the Suez Crisis, Israeli forces killed many Palestinians in Khan Yunis and its refugee camp in the Gaza Strip.

title: Sabra and Shatila Massacres
description: In September 1982, Phalangist militia, with Israeli military authorization, massacred Palestinian refugees in Sabra and Shatila camps in Beirut.

title: Al-Aqsa Massacre
description: Known as Black Monday, this massacre occurred in the Al-Aqsa compound in Jerusalem during the First Intifada.

title: Ibrahimi Mosque Massacre
description: In February 1994, Baruch Goldstein, an extremist associated with the Kach movement, killed worshippers in the Ibrahimi Mosque in Hebron.

title: Jenin Refugee Camp
description: During the Second Intifada, Israeli forces' operation in the Jenin Refugee Camp resulted in at least 54 Palestinian deaths.

title: Gaza Massacre
description: The Gaza Massacre began on December 27, 2008, when Israel launched a large-scale military campaign in the Gaza Strip following the end of a six-month truce between Hamas and Israel.

title: Gaza Conflict
description: In October 2012, Israel initiated assassinations of Hamas leaders, leading to a response from Hamas. In November, the conflict escalated with the assassination of Ahmad Jabari, leading to a series of retaliatory attacks.

title: 2014 Gaza War
description: On July 8, 2014, another extensive Gaza War began, triggered by the abduction of three Israelis. The 50-day conflict resulted in the death of 2,205 Palestinians and marked the third major confrontation between Israel and Hamas.

title: Great March of Return
description: The Gaza border protests, known as the Great March of Return, were peaceful demonstrations from March 30, 2018, to December 27, 2019. Israeli forces killed 223 Palestinians and injured over 13,000 during these protests.

title: Sheikh Jarrah Crisis
description: The crisis began with the planned eviction of six Palestinian families from the Sheikh Jarrah neighborhood in Jerusalem, leading to widespread protests in East Jerusalem.

title: 2023 Gaza Conflict
description: In 2023, Israel launched a massive attack on the Gaza Strip, resulting in over 40,000 Palestinian deaths, numerous war crimes, and the maiming and orphaning of tens of thousands.

title: Occupied West Bank
description: In the Occupied West Bank, Israel has killed at least 576 people, including more than 138 children, and injured more than 5,350 individuals. (Hamas doesn't exist in the West Bank.)

title: Every hour in Gaza
description: 15 people are killed - six are children - 35 people are injured - 42 bombs are dropped* -12 buildings are destroyed - 2 mothers killed

title: Man-Made Hunger
description: The Israeli blockade of water and food, combined with incessant bombing, has caused unprecedented levels of hunger in Gaza. Tragically, 32 children have died due to malnutrition and dehydration, and the number is rising.

title: Healthcare Disaster
description: Over 60,000 pregnant women in Gaza cannot receive health care, and 350,000 people with chronic illnesses are at risk of death due to lack of medication. According to the report, there are no fully functional hospitals in Gaza, and only 9 out of 36 hospitals remain partially functional.

title: No Students Left
description: The Israeli army destroyed 171 government facilities and 100 schools and universities, and 305 schools and universities were partially damaged. The 2023/2024 academic year is canceled. (Above is Gaza's last remaining university getting blown up to dust)

title: Journalists killed
description: As of April 5, more than 100 journalists, mostly Palestinians, have been killed since the Israel-Gaza war began on October 7. According to the Committee to Protect Journalists and the International Federation of Journalists, 96 Palestinian, three Lebanese and four Israeli journalists have been killed.

title: Devastation across Gaza
description: More than half of Gaza’s homes have been destroyed or damaged - 80% of commercial facilities - 88% of school buildings - 16 out of 35 hospitals are partially functioning - 130 ambulances - 267 places of worship

title: Flour Massacre
description: At 4 a.m., a massacre was carried out by Israeli forces, killing at least 118 Palestinians as they gathered to receive flour. More than 1,000 people were injured.

title: Nasser's Hospital Massacre
description: 392 bodies – including women, children, elderly, and injured persons – were found in mass graves on the grounds of Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis. Some bodies had their limbs bound together, others were blindfolded, indicating a massive field execution.

title: Nuseirat Massacre
description: Over 200 Palestinian civilians, including children, were killed in the Israeli massacre in Nuseirat refugee camp, with over 600 injured. Israel's 'rescue' mission resulted in the freeing of 4 hostages but also the death of 3 others.

title: Thousands Maimed
description: Nearly 10,000 Palestinians, half of them children, have been disabled since the start of the war on Gaza, according to the Palestinian NGO Network.

title: Thousands Missing
description: More than 10,000 people have been reported missing under the rubble in Gaza since the start of the recent war. This humanitarian catastrophe highlights the immense suffering faced by the civilian population in the region.

title: The Mawasi Massacre
description: The Al Mawasi Massacre was committed by Israel with fighter jets on displaced people's tents, killing 110+ Palestinians and wounding 300+. EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM WAS A CIVILIAN

title: Mass detentions
description: Israeli occupation forces have arrested more than 9700 Palestinian citizens since the beginning of the aggression on Gaza on October 7th. According to the Commission of Detainees and Ex-Detainees Affairs and the Prisoners' Club, the arrests were accompanied by widespread abuse, beatings, threats against detainees and their families, and destruction of homes.

title: UNRWA Casualties
description: The highest number of casualties in UN history: 193 UNRWA staff members have been killed in Gaza since the start of the occupation's war.

title: The Tent Massacre
description: The Rafah Massacre, also known as the Tent Massacre, was carried out by occupation forces, resulting in the martyrdom of 45 Palestinians, including 23 women, children, and elderly people. Another 249 were injured. Israeli planes dropped bombs on the camp, causing a fire that consumed 14 tents. Bodies were torn apart, children were left headless, and limbs were charred.

title: White phosphorus
description: Israeli forces' use of white phosphorus bombs in Lebanon and Gaza has caused long-term damage to the environment, agriculture, and economy. Human rights groups believe Israel intentionally uses white phosphorus to create buffer zones, harass residents, and displace people from farmlands.

title: IDF dogs
description: The Israeli military has used police dogs to systematically attack Palestinian civilians during military operations in the Gaza Strip. The dogs were also used to intimidate, beat, and sexually assault prisoners and detainees in Israeli detention facilities.

title: Al-Ahli Arab Hospital Bombing
description: A massive explosion at Al-Ahli Arab Hospital in Gaza City killed at least 500 Palestinians seeking shelter. The hospital courtyard was packed with displaced families when it was struck, causing one of the single deadliest incidents of the war.

title: Jabalia Refugee Camp Bombing
description: Israeli airstrikes on Jabalia refugee camp, the largest in Gaza, killed over 110 Palestinians and wounded hundreds. The strikes destroyed entire residential blocks, with many victims buried under rubble. Israel admitted targeting the densely populated area.

title: Al-Shifa Hospital Siege
description: Israeli forces laid siege to Al-Shifa Hospital, Gaza's largest medical facility, cutting off power, water, and supplies. Patients on life support died, and premature babies in incubators perished. The hospital was raided despite housing thousands of patients and displaced civilians.

title: Israeli Soldiers Execute Shirtless Palestinians
description: Video footage emerged showing Israeli soldiers executing three shirtless Palestinian men who were waving white flags in Gaza City. The men were unarmed and attempting to surrender when they were shot dead. Israel later admitted they were likely Israeli hostages mistakenly killed.

title: Kamal Adwan Hospital Attacks
description: Repeated Israeli attacks on Kamal Adwan Hospital in northern Gaza killed medical staff and patients. The hospital's director was detained and tortured, and medical facilities were systematically destroyed, leaving northern Gaza without functioning hospitals.

title: Mass Graves at Al-Nasser Hospital
description: After Israeli forces withdrew from Al-Nasser Hospital complex, mass graves containing over 400 bodies were discovered. Many victims showed signs of execution, including being bound and blindfolded. Evidence suggested systematic killings during the hospital's occupation.

title: Al-Amal Hospital Siege
description: Israeli forces besieged Al-Amal Hospital in Khan Younis, trapping medical staff, patients, and displaced civilians for weeks. Snipers targeted anyone approaching the hospital. The siege resulted in deaths from lack of medical care and direct targeting.

title: Aid Convoy Massacre on Al-Rashid Street
description: Israeli forces opened fire on Palestinians waiting for humanitarian aid on Al-Rashid Street in Gaza City, killing at least 112 people and wounding over 760. The starving civilians were waiting for food trucks when they were shot.

title: World Central Kitchen Workers Killed
description: An Israeli airstrike deliberately targeted a clearly marked World Central Kitchen convoy, killing seven international aid workers from Australia, Poland, UK, and Palestine. The three vehicles were hit in succession despite coordination with Israeli military.

title: Al-Maghazi Camp Massacre
description: Israeli airstrikes on Al-Maghazi refugee camp in central Gaza killed more than 70 Palestinians, mostly women and children. The strikes hit residential buildings housing displaced families, causing entire apartments to collapse on their inhabitants.

title: Rafah Ground Invasion
description: Despite international warnings and ICJ orders, Israel launched a ground invasion of Rafah, where over 1.4 million displaced Palestinians had sought refuge. The invasion caused mass displacement and destruction of the last supposed 'safe zone' in Gaza.

title: Deir al-Balah School Massacre
description: An Israeli airstrike on Al-Tabieen School in Deir al-Balah, which was sheltering displaced families, killed at least 90 Palestinians during dawn prayers. The school was packed with refugees who had been told it was a safe location.

title: Al-Tabeen School Massacre
description: In one of the deadliest single incidents, Israeli airstrikes hit Al-Tabeen School in Gaza City, killing over 100 Palestinians who were sheltering there. The attack occurred during Fajr prayers, with bodies burned beyond recognition.

title: Jabalia Ethnic Cleansing
description: Israel implemented a plan to completely empty northern Gaza, particularly Jabalia, of its population. Entire neighborhoods were razed, and those who refused to leave were killed. The operation involved systematic destruction and mass displacement in what experts called ethnic cleansing.

title: Beit Lahia Residential Tower Collapse
description: Israeli airstrikes on a five-story residential building in Beit Lahia killed at least 93 Palestinians, including 25 children. The building housed multiple displaced families who had been told to evacuate to northern Gaza.

title: Kamal Adwan Hospital Final Assault
description: Israeli forces launched a final assault on Kamal Adwan Hospital, arresting medical staff including the director, and forcing evacuation of all patients. The hospital was completely destroyed, leaving northern Gaza with no functioning medical facilities.

title: Nuseirat School Shelter Bombing
description: Israeli strikes on schools in Nuseirat refugee camp sheltering displaced families killed over 70 Palestinians. The attacks hit during night hours when families were sleeping, causing massive casualties among women and children.

title: Systematic Destruction of Northern Gaza
description: By January 2025, Israel had systematically destroyed all infrastructure in northern Gaza. Satellite imagery showed complete devastation of entire neighborhoods, with UN experts stating the destruction appeared designed to make the area uninhabitable.

title: Systematic Sexual Violence in Detention
description: Multiple investigations by UN and human rights organizations documented systematic sexual violence and rape of Palestinian detainees in Israeli detention facilities, including Sde Teiman. Testimonies revealed horrific abuse of men, women, and children in custody.

title: Torture at Sde Teiman Detention Camp
description: Sde Teiman military base was converted into a detention facility where Palestinian detainees faced systematic torture, including beatings, electric shocks, sexual abuse, and prolonged stress positions. Multiple detainees died from torture, and many were released with permanent disabilities.

title: Targeting of Medical Personnel
description: Over 500 medical workers have been killed in Gaza since October 2023, many deliberately targeted while on duty. Ambulances have been repeatedly struck, and medical teams attacked while attempting to rescue the wounded. This represents the highest death toll of healthcare workers in any conflict.

title: Weaponized Starvation
description: Israel's complete blockade prevented food, water, and humanitarian aid from entering Gaza, deliberately using starvation as a weapon of war. Children died from malnutrition and dehydration, and famine conditions were documented across Gaza. This policy was identified as a war crime by international experts.
